</TR>

</TABLE>



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->21<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Certificate, the business scope set out in the Business License, any
Additional Permit or any Tax Concession and it cannot be resolved to
the satisfaction of the Party concerned within sixty (60)&nbsp;days of the
issue of the relevant document containing or imposing the Material
Modification; or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(vi)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The conditions or consequences of Force Majeure
(as hereinafter defined) have a material adverse effect on the business,
assets or operations of the Company and continue for a period in excess
of six (6)&nbsp;months and the Parties have been unable to find an equitable
solution; or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(vii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Company is denied access to foreign exchange
for a period in excess of six (6)&nbsp;months, which denial has a material
adverse effect on the business, assets or operations of the Company; or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(viii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Company incurs for &#091;****&#093; (&#091;****&#093;) consecutive years aggregate
operating losses in excess of &#091;****&#093; percent (&#091;****&#093;%) of the Company&#146;s
registered capital; or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ix)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Company is unable due to Applicable Laws to
remit or otherwise pay after-tax profits to Party B and/or Party C; or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(x)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Any Party materially breaches any other contract
or agreement, including, without limitation, any licensing agreement and
service agreement, which was entered into by the Parties and/or their
Affiliates and/ or any Party and the Company in connection with the
establishment and operation of the Company&#146;s business; or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(xi)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The legal or beneficial ownership of &#091;****&#093;
percent (&#091;****&#093;%) or more of the equity capital of the other Party is
acquired by a person or entity which directly, or through its
Affiliates, competes against the Company.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">The mere submission by the Notifying Party of a notice indicating an intention to terminate this
Contract shall not by itself constitute a termination of this Contract. Upon the occurrence of any
of the foregoing events, in addition to its other rights under this Contract or under Applicable
Laws of the PRC, a Party entitled to give notice of intent to terminate this Contract shall have
the right to suspend performance of its obligations under this Contract until such time as such
event is resolved.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;16.2 Notification and Termination Procedure
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In the event that the Notifying Party gives written notice of a
desire to terminate this Contract, the Parties shall conduct negotiations for a
thirty (30)&nbsp;day period after such notice is given in an effort to resolve the
situation which resulted in the giving of such notice. In the event such
matters are not resolved to the satisfaction of the Parties within such thirty
(30)&nbsp;day period, or such longer period as the Parties may agree in writing, the
Notifying Party shall have the right by written notice to the other Party:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>to declare this Contract terminated, or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>to initiate the equity buy-out procedures;
provided that the equity buy-out procedures do not result in a violation
of Applicable Laws associated with ownership restrictions. The Parties
agree that if Party B or Party C elects to initiate the equity buy-out
procedure, the buy-out shall be of both Party B&#146;s and Party C&#146;s interest
in the Company, unless Party B or Party C otherwise notify Party A in
writing to the contrary. If the Parties opt-out of the equity buy-out</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><B>****</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Confidential Treatment Requested</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->22<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>process, then, the Notifying Party again shall have the right to
declare this Contract terminated.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>As soon as practicable following termination of this Contract
upon the expiration of the Term, the early termination of this Contract by the
agreement of the Parties, or the Notifying Party&#146;s declaration of termination,
an emergency Board meeting shall be held at which each Party shall cause the
directors appointed by it to attend such Board meeting in person, by proxy or
by telecommunications and to vote in favor of an unanimous resolution approving
the termination of this Contract or to sign a written resolution circulated in
lieu of such a meeting of the Board, as the case may be.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Following such Board approval of the termination of this
Contract, the Board shall submit a dissolution application to the original
Examination and Approval Authority for approval. Following such approval, such
approved dissolution application shall be registered with the SAIC. If the
other Party fails to co-operate in such termination and dissolution procedures,
then to the extent permitted under Applicable Laws, the Notifying Party shall
have the unilateral right to submit an application for termination and
dissolution to the Examination and Approval Authority and register such
approved termination and dissolution application with the SAIC.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Following such registration with the SAIC, the Parties shall
cause the Company to then be dissolved and liquidated in accordance with the
relevant procedures under the Applicable Laws of the PRC and this Contract.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;16.3 Equity Buy-Out Provision
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If the Notifying Party elects to proceed with the equity
buy-out provisions in this Contract, then the Parties shall determine the value
of the Company in accordance with the following provisions:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Parties shall conduct negotiations on the
valuation of the Company for a period of thirty (30)&nbsp;days after the date
of such notice (&#147;negotiation period&#148;). If the Parties are unable to
agree on the valuation of the Company by the end of such negotiation
period, or such longer period as the Parties may agree in writing; the
Parties shall jointly conduct a valuation of the Company in accordance
with subsection (ii)&nbsp;below, or</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>An Independent Appraiser appointed by the
Company, at the cost and expenses of the Company, shall conduct a
valuation of the Company using the Industry Valuation Method. The
Independent Appraiser shall complete the valuation of the Company within
forty-five (45)&nbsp;days. The value determined by the Independent Appraiser
shall be the value adopted by the Parties for purposes of this buy-out
provision.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The purchase price (&#147;Buy-out Price&#148;) for a Party&#146;s share of the
registered capital of the Company shall be calculated by multiplying the value
of the Company as determined by the percentage of such Party&#146;s share of the
registered capital of the Company at the time of valuation.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Upon completion of the valuation:</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Parties shall conduct negotiations within
thirty (30)&nbsp;days to decide whether either a Party or the Parties desire
to purchase any or all of the Selling Party&#146;s interest in the registered
capital of the Company at the applicable Buy-out Price. If so, the
Parties shall proceed with the buy-out provisions in this Contract. If</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><B>****</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Confidential Treatment Requested</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->23<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>not, or if at the end of such thirty (30)&nbsp;day period no agreement is
reached, then unless the Parties otherwise agree in writing, the
Parties shall be deemed to have opted-out of these equity buy-out
provisions and the Notifying Party shall have the right to declare
this Contract terminated and proceed with dissolution and liquidation
of the Company.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If only one Party has indicated an interest in
purchasing any or all of the other Party&#146;s share of the registered
capital of the Company, then such proposed purchasing Party shall
promptly provide written confirmation of such intention to the other
Party. If such proposed purchasing Party fails to provide such
confirmation to the other Party in writing within thirty (30)&nbsp;days after
completion of the valuation of the Company, such purchasing Party shall
be deemed to have elected to decline to proceed with such purchase.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(iii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If no Party elects to purchase the other Party&#146;s
share of the registered capital of the Company at the applicable Buy-out
Price, and the Parties are not otherwise able to reach agreement on the
purchase by one Party of the other Party&#146;s share of the registered
capital of the Company, then the Parties shall be deemed to have
opted-out of these equity buy-out provisions, and the Notifying Party
shall have the right to declare this Contract terminated and proceed
with dissolution and liquidation of the Company.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Such sale and purchase of a Party&#146;s share of the registered
capital of the Company shall comply with the requirements of the Applicable
Laws of the PRC. The Buy Out Price shall be paid in accordance with the
provisions of the relevant contracts to be signed by the Parties.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(e)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Until such time as the sale and purchase of a Party&#146;s share of
the registered capital of the Company is completed, the Parties shall cause the
Company, to the fullest extent possible, to maintain the conduct of its
business in the ordinary course and no Party shall hinder the Company from
conducting its business.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(f)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If the purchasing Party under these equity buy-out provisions
cannot complete the buy-out due to ownership restrictions pursuant to
Applicable Laws, such purchasing Party may elect to have a designee purchase
such Selling Party&#146;s interest.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;16.4 Liquidation
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days following approval and registration of
the dissolution application, the Board shall appoint a liquidation committee
which shall have the power to represent the Company in all legal matters. The
liquidation committee shall perform its responsibilities in accordance with
Applicable Laws and the principles set out herein.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The liquidation committee shall consist of at least four (4)
numbers of directors of the Board, of whom at least one (1)&nbsp;of director
appointed by Party A, Party B, and Party C, respectively shall be included.
Members of the liquidation committee may be Board directors, senior employees
of the Company or relevant professionals. The members of the liquidation
committee shall bear fiduciary responsibilities to the Company and comply in
all respects with the requirements of Applicable Laws of the PRC in the
discharge of their duties. The liquidation committee shall act by majority vote
following consultation save where otherwise required under Applicable Laws of
the PRC.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The liquidation committee shall appoint the Independent
Appraiser to conduct a valuation of the Company&#146;s assets on a current fair
market value basis.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><B>****</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Confidential Treatment Requested</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>



<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->24<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(d)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>On completion of all liquidation procedures in accordance with
Applicable Laws, the liquidation committee shall submit a final report to the
Board for confirmation. The Board shall convene an emergency meeting to review
and confirm such report. Following such confirmation by the Board the report
shall be submitted to the Examination and Approval Authority for the record.
The liquidation committee shall then carry out all de-registration procedures
in accordance with the Applicable Laws of the PRC. Each Party shall have a
right to obtain copies of all of the Company&#146;s accounting books and other
documents at its own expense but the originals thereof shall be left in the
care of Party A.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;16.5 Continuing Obligations
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The provisions of Article&nbsp;7 (Board of Directors) (but only in respect of Board action required
to be taken following termination of this Contract and prior to de-registration of the Company),
Article&nbsp;15 (The Joint Venture Term), Article&nbsp;16 (Termination, Dissolution, Buyout and Liquidation),
Article&nbsp;17 (Breach of Contract) (but only with respect to claims arising prior to the termination
hereof or with respect to other continuing obligations), Article&nbsp;18 (Confidentiality) and Article
20 (Dispute Resolution) and the provisions of Schedule&nbsp;A (Definitions and Interpretation) (to the
extent required to interpret the aforesaid) shall survive the termination of this Contract and the
termination, dissolution, liquidation and de-registration of the Company.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">17. <B>BREACH OF CONTRACT</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;17.1 Remedies for Breach of Contract
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except as otherwise provided herein, if a Party (&#147;breaching Party&#148;) fails to perform any of
its material obligations under this Contact or otherwise is in material breach of this Contract,
then the other Parties (&#147;aggrieved Parties&#148;) may, collectively or individually:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Give written notice to the breaching Party describing the
nature and scope of the breach and demanding that the breaching Party cure the
breach at its cost within a reasonable time specified in the notice (&#147;Cure
Period&#148;) (provided that if any representation and warranty of a Party is not
true and correct in all material respects when made, then there shall be no
Cure Period); and</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If the breaching Party fails to cure the breach within the Cure
Period (or, if there is none, at any time following such breach), then in
addition to its other rights under this Contort or the Applicable Laws of the
PRC, the aggrieved Party may claim direct and foreseeable damages arising from
the breach.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;17.2 Limitation on Liability
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding any other provision of this Contract, except for a breach of confidentiality
or infringement of the other Party&#146;s IPR, no Party shall be liable to the other Party or Parties
for damages for loss of revenues or profits, loss of goodwill or any indirect consequential
damages in connection with the performance or non-performance of this Contract. Except for a breach
of confidentiality or infringement of the other Party&#146;s IPR, the aggregate liability of a Party for
all claims for any loss, damage or indemnity whatsoever resulting from such Party&#146;s performance or
non-performance of this Contract shall in no case exceed &#091;****&#093; United States Dollars (US$&#091;****&#093;)
or the RMB equivalent thereof.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">18. <B>CONFIDENTIALITY</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;18.1 Confidentiality Obligations
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;From time to time prior to and during the Term, either Party (&#147;disclosing Party&#148;) has
disclosed or may disclose Confidential Information to the other Party (&#147;receiving Party&#148;). The
receiving Party shall, during the Term of this Contract and for two (2)&nbsp;years thereafter:
</DIV>



<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<P><HR noshade><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Maintain the confidentiality of Confidential Information;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Not use Confidential Information for any purposes other than
those specifically set out in this Contract; and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Not disclose any such Confidential Information to any person or
entity, except to its employees or employees of its Affiliates, its agents,
attorneys, accountants and other advisors who need to know such information to
perform their responsibilities and who have signed written confidentiality
agreements containing terms at least as stringent as the terms provided in this
Article (collectively &#147;Permitted Disclosure Parties&#148;).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;18.2 Confidentiality Exceptions
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The provisions of Article&nbsp;18.1 above shall not apply to information that:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Known by the receiving Party;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Is or becomes public knowledge otherwise than through the
receiving Party&#146;s breach of this Contract; or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Is obtained by the receiving Party from a third party having no
obligation of confidentiality with respect to such information.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;18.3 Confidentiality Rules
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Party shall formulate rules and regulations to inform its directors, senior staff, and
other employees, and those of their Affiliates of the confidentiality obligation set forth in this
Article.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;18.4 Return of Materials
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon the Expiration Date, or upon the disclosing Party&#146;s request at any time, the receiving
Party shall (i)&nbsp;return to the disclosing Party, or upon such disclosing Party&#146;s direction, destroy
all materials (including any copies thereof) embodying the other Party&#146;s Confidential Information,
and (ii)&nbsp;certify in writing to the disclosing Party, within ten (10)&nbsp;days following the disclosing
Party&#146;s request, that all of such materials have been returned or destroyed.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">19. <B>FORCE MAJEURE</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;19.1 Definition of Force Majeure
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Force Majeure&#148; shall mean all events which are beyond the control of the Parties to this
Contract, and which are unforeseen, unavoidable and insurmountable, and which prevent total or
partial performance by either of the Parties; provided, however, a &#147;Force Majeure&#148; event shall not
occur with respect to remittance or distribution of after-tax profits or termination for breach due
to the creation, adoption, or existence of Applicable Laws. Such Force Majeure events shall include
earthquakes, typhoons, epidemic, flood, fire, war, strikes, riots, acts of governments, changes in
law or the application thereof or any other instances which cannot be foreseen, prevented or
controlled, including instances which are accepted as Force Majeure in general international
commercial practice.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;19.2 Consequences of Force Majeure
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If an event of Force Majeure occurs, a Party&#146;s contractual
obligations affected by such an event under this Contract shall be suspended
during the period of delay caused by the Force Majeure and shall be
automatically extended, without penalty or liability, for a period equal to
such suspension.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>

    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><B>****</B></TD>

    <TD><B>Confidential Treatment Requested</B></TD>

</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The Party claiming Force Majeure shall promptly inform the
other Parties in writing and shall furnish within fifteen (15)&nbsp;days thereafter
sufficient proof of the occurrence and duration of such Force Majeure. The
Party claiming Force Majeure shall also use all reasonable endeavours to
terminate the Force Majeure.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In the event of Force Majeure, the Parties shall immediately
consult with each other in order to find an equitable solution and shall use
all reasonable endeavours to minimize the consequences of such Force Majeure.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">20. <B>DISPUTE RESOLUTION</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;20.1 Friendly Consultations
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event of any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Contract,
or the breach, termination or invalidity hereof (&#147;dispute&#148;), any Party may send written notice of
such dispute (a &#147;Dispute Notice&#148;) to the other applicable Parties. The Parties shall promptly make
all reasonable attempts to resolve such dispute through friendly consultations.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;20.2 Arbitration
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In the event the dispute is not resolved by such friendly
consultations, any Party may at any time that is not less than thirty (30)
days-after the date of the Dispute Notice, submit the dispute to Singapore
International Arbitration Centre (&#147;SIAC&#148;) for arbitration in Singapore in
accordance with the Arbitration Rules of the SIAC then in force, and as amended
by this Article&nbsp;20.2 (&#147;Arbitration Rules&#148;), including its rules with respect to
choice of law and conflict of laws.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The tribunal shall consist of three (3)&nbsp;arbitrators to be
appointed by the Chairman of the SIAC. At least one of the three arbiters shall
be neither a citizen of the PRC nor of the United States.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>The language of the arbitration shall be English.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;20.3 Procedural Compliance
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Parties undertake:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>To comply strictly with the time limits specified in the
Arbitration Rules for the taking of any step or the performance of any act in
or in connection with any arbitration; and</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>To comply with and to carry out, in full and without delay, any
procedural orders (including, without limitation to, any interim measures of
protection ordered) or any award (interim or final) made by the arbitral
tribunal.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;20.4 Enforcement of Award
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Party irrevocably:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Agrees that any arbitral award reached by the Tribunal shall be
final and binding with no right of appeal;</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Undertakes that it will execute and perform the arbitral award
fully and without delay. In the event of judicial acceptance and an order of
enforcement, each party expressly waives all rights to object thereto,
including any defense of sovereign immunity and any other</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>defense based on the fact or allegation that it is an agency or
instrumentality of a sovereign state; and</TD>
</TR>

</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Waives any rights which it may have to contest the validity of
the arbitration agreement set forth in this Article or the jurisdiction of the
relevant arbitration institution to hear and to determine any arbitration begun
pursuant to this Article&nbsp;20.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;When any dispute occurs and is the subject of friendly consultations or arbitration, the
Parties shall continue to exercise their remaining respective rights and fulfill their remaining
respective obligations under this Contract, except in respect of those matters under dispute.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;20.5 Injunctive Relief
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notwithstanding the foregoing, each Party has the right to seek temporary or permanent
injunctive or other similar relief in any court or other authority of competent jurisdiction in
respect of any claims of breach of order of specific performance or other injunctive relief as
permitted under the Applicable Laws of the PRC.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">21. <B>APPLICABLE LAW</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The establishment, effectiveness, validity, interpretation, implementation of, and dispute
resolution with respect to, this Contract shall be governed by the laws of the People&#146;s Republic of
China.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">22. <B>GENERAL PROVISIONS</B>
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.1 Independent Contractor Relationship
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt; margin-left: 2%">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nothing in this Contract shall be construed or implied as:
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Constituting any of the Parties hereto as the agent of the
other Party or Parties (except with the other Party&#146;s prior written consent);
or</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Authorizing any Party to incur any expenses or any other form
of obligation on behalf of the other Party or the Parties (except with the
other Party&#146;s prior written consent).</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.2 Binding Effect
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Contract is made for the benefit of the Parties hereto and their respective lawful
successors and assignees and is legally binding on them.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.3 Amendment
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In no circumstance can this Contract be amended, modified or changed verbally. No amendment,
modification or change to any part of this Contact may be effective unless by written instrument
signed by all the Parties under the Applicable Laws of the PRC, and, if required by the Applicable
Laws of the PRC, by approval by the relevant Examination and Approval Authority.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.4 No Publicity
</DIV>


<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The contents of this Contract shall be deemed to fall within the scope of Confidential
Information and shall be subject to Article&nbsp;18 and shall not be disclosed in whole or in part to
any person or entity, except to (i)&nbsp;Permitted Disclosure Parties, (ii)&nbsp;to authorized securities
regulators or exchanges in accordance with the Applicable Laws of the PRC or the relevant rules of
the securities exchange to which the Party in question is subject, (iii)&nbsp;to officials in relevant
government departments pursuant to the requirements of the Applicable Laws of the PRC, (iv)&nbsp;in
order to fulfill any conditions precedent to the effectiveness of this Contract, (v)&nbsp;for the
purpose of the performance by a Party of its obligations or exercise of its rights hereunder or
relating hereto, (vi)&nbsp;for the other bona fide purposes of the Company after its establishment,
(vii)&nbsp;as required under the law of the jurisdiction where any Party is incorporated, or (viii)&nbsp;as
otherwise jointly agreed to by the Parties.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.5 Notices
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Any notice or written communication provided for in this
Contract by any Party to the other, including but not limited to any and all
offers, writings, or notices to be given hereunder, shall be made in Chinese
and English either:</TD>
</TR>
</table>
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>By hand delivery; or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>By courier service delivered letter;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(iii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>By facsimile, or</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(iv)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>By electronic approach, including e-mail.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Notices shall be deemed to have been delivered at the following
times:</TD>
</TR>
</table>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(i)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If by hand delivery, on reaching the designated
address and subject to return receipt or other proof of delivery;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(ii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If by courier, on the date shown the delivery was
completed by the courier;</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(iii)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If by fax, on the next Business Day following
the date marked on the confirmation of transmission report by the
sender&#146;s fax machine, indicating completed, uninterrupted transmission
to the relevant facsimile number, and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="8%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(iv)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>If by E-mail or any electronic approach, on the
next Business Day following the date on which the message was
transmitted as shown on the sending device.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>

<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(c)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>During the Term, each Party may change its particulars for
receipt of notices at any time by notice given to the other Party in accordance
with this Article.</TD>
</TR>
</table>
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.6 Severability
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Wherever possible, the terms of this Contract shall be construed and interpreted so as to be
valid, enforceable, and permissible under Applicable Laws. If any provision of this Contract or any
document contemplated hereby shall be deemed invalid, unenforceable, or prohibited under Applicable
Laws, such provision shall be invalid, unenforceable, or prohibited only to the extent of such
invalidity, unenforceability, or prohibition, and the Parties shall consult and attempt in good
faith to agree on a legally acceptable modification that gives effect to the
</DIV>



<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><B>****</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Confidential Treatment Requested</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>




<P align="right" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->30<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>




<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>
<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">commercial objectives of the invalid, unenforceable, or prohibited provision, and every other
provision of such document shall remain in full force and effect. Should any provision of this
Contract be invalid because of its territorial or factual scope of application or because of its
duration, the provision shall be reduced to the maximum allowed by Applicable Laws.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.7 Entire Agreement
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Contract and the Schedules and Annexes hereto constitute the entire agreement between the
Parties hereto with respect to the subject matter of this Contract and supersede all prior
discussions, negotiations and agreements between them, including, the Letter of Intent between
Shenzhen Airlines and the Mesa Air Group, Inc. Dated on July &#95;&#95;&#95;, 2006.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.8 Waiver
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any Party&#146;s failure to exercise or delay in exercising any right, power or privilege under
this Contract shall not operate as a waiver thereof, and any single or partial exercise of any
right, power or privilege shall not preclude the exercise of any other right, power or privilege.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.9 Further Endeavour
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Each Party shall, at any time, upon the request of the other Party or Parties, execute or
procure the execution of such documents, agreements, contracts or deeds and do or procure the doing
of such acts and things as may be reasonably necessary to give full effect to the provisions of
this Contract.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.10 Costs
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless provided otherwise in this Contact, each Party shall bear its own legal and other
professional costs in relation to the preparation, negotiation and entry into of this Contract.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.11 Articles of Association
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In case of any inconsistency between the Articles of Association of the Company and this
Contract, this Contract shall prevail.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.12 Schedules and Annexes
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Schedules and Annexes hereto are made integral parts to this Contract and are equally
binding with the main body of the Contract. In the event of any conflict between the terms and
provisions of the main body of the Contract and the Schedules or Annexes, the terms and provisions
of the main body of this Contract shall prevail.
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;22.13 Language
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Contract is executed in the Chinese language in five (5)&nbsp;originals and in the English
language in five (5)&nbsp;originals. Both language versions shall be equally authentic.
</DIV>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="center" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 18pt">SCHEDULE A &#151; DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION
</DIV>


<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Part A &#150; Definitions
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">Unless the terms or context of this Contract otherwise provide, the following terms shall have the
meanings set out below:
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Additional Permits&#148; means any other permits, approvals or consents required by Applicable Law or
any governing body with authority over the Company in order to establish the Company or enable the
Company to operate its business as contemplated under this Contract.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Affiliate&#148; means any company which, directly or indirectly, is controlled by, under common control
with, or in control of, a Party; the term &#147;control&#148; being used in the sense of power to elect or
appoint a majority of directors or to direct the management of a company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Applicable Laws&#148; means the laws, regulations, rules, notices, and other legislative, executive or
judicial decisions or pronouncements binding on either Party, the Company or in relation to the
subject matter of this Contract.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Approval Certificate&#148; means the certificate issued by the Examination and Approval Authority
approving the establishment of the Company and this Contract and the Articles of Association.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Approval Document&#148; means the documents or instruments required pursuant to Article&nbsp;5.4(c)(i) and
(ii)&nbsp;of this Contract.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Approval Letter&#148; means the approval reply issued by the Examination and Approval Authority
approving the establishment of the Company and this Contract and the Articles of Association of the
Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Articles of Association&#148; means the Articles of Association of the Company executed by the Parties.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Board&#148; means the board of directors of the Company, as constituted from time to time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Business&#148; means the business undertaken by the Company from time to time in accordance with the
Business Plan.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Business Day&#148; means:
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(a)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In respect of any action to be taken in the PRC, any day on
which companies in the PRC are generally open for business in the PRC,
including a Saturday or Sunday which the PRC government temporarily declares to
be a working day (&#147;Working Rest Day&#148;), but excluding statutory holiday, or
Saturday or Sunday other than a Working Rest Day; and</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="4%" style="background: transparent">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">(b)</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>In respect of any action to be taken in the United States of
America, any day on which companies in the United States of America are
generally open for business in the United States of America.</TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Business License&#148; means the first business license of the Company issued by the SAIC.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Business License Issuance Date&#148; means the date the Business License is issued to the Company by
the SAIC.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Business Plan&#148; means the business plan for the Company as approved by the Board from time to time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Chief Financial Officer&#148; means the Chief Financial Officer or Chief Accountant of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;China&#148; and &#147;PRC&#148; mean the mainland of the People&#146;s Republic of China.
</DIV>



<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">
<TR>
    <TD width="3%"></TD>
    <TD width="1%"></TD>
    <TD width="96"></TD>
</TR>

<TR valign="top">
    <TD nowrap align="left"><B>****</B></TD>
    <TD>&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD><B>Confidential Treatment Requested</B></TD>
</TR>

</TABLE>


<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->Schedule A-1<!-- /Folio -->
</DIV>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">





<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Company&#148; means the Sino-foreign Equity Joint Venture Company to be established by the Parties
pursuant to this Contract and the Articles of Association.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Confidential Information&#148; means any business, marketing, technical, scientific or other
information disclosed by any Party (or its Affiliates) which, at the time of disclosure, is
designated as confidential (or like designation), is disclosed in circumstances of confidence, or
would be understood by the Parties, exercising reasonable business judgment, to be confidential.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Effective Date&#148; means the effective date of this Contract, being the date on which this Contract
has been approved by the Examination and Approval Authority.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;EJV Law&#148; means the Law of the PRC on Sino-Foreign Equity Joint Ventures passed on 1 July, 1979, as
amended.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;EJV Implementing Regulations&#148; means the Regulations for the Implementation of the Law of the PRC
on Equity Joint Ventures promulgated on 20 September&nbsp;1983, as amended.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Encumbrance&#148; means any claim, deposit, charge, mortgage, security, pledge, lien, option, equity,
power of sale or hypothecation or other third party right, retention of title arrangement, right of
pre-emption, right of first refusal of security interest of any kind.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Enterprise Accounting System&#148; means the general Accounting System for Enterprises promulgated by
the MOF on Feb. 15, 2006 to replace the Accounting System for Foreign Investment Enterprises
promulgated on 24 June&nbsp;1992, which was applicable to foreign investment enterprises as of 1 January
2002.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Examination and Approval Authority&#148; means the MOFCOM or other authority entrusted by it to approve
this Contract and the establishment of the Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Independent Appraiser&#148; means a leading independent, competent, and industry recognized appraiser
registered in China and authorized to perform appraisals of state-owned and other assets selected
by the Company&#146;s Independent Auditor at the request of either Party.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Independent Auditor&#148; means the internationally recognized independent and competent accountant
registered in China.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Industry Valuation Method&#148; means valuation method(s) selected by the Independent Appraiser in
consultation with the Parties, including the Selling Party, which shall be valuation methods(s)
commonly used in international practice in valuing enterprises in the Company&#146;s industry on a going
concern basis, but, where the assets or equity interests in question constitute State-owned assets
under Applicable Laws, it shall refer to a valuation method which complies with, and satisfies the
requirements of Applicable Laws relating to State-owned assets.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Intellectual Property Rights&#148; or &#147;IPR&#148; means any and all rights in any invention, discovery,
improvement, utility, model, copyrightable work, industrial design or mask work, algorithm, data
structure, trade secrets or know-how, Confidential Information, or any idea having commercial
value. IPR shall include any trademark, trade dress, trade name, domain name, or other marks that
serve to identify and distinguish goods or services as coming from, or falling under the control
of, a single source. IPR shall include all rights of whatsoever nature in computer software and
data, all intangible rights or privileges of a nature similar to any of the foregoing in every case
in any part of the world and whether or not registered, and all rights in any applications and
granted registrations for any of the foregoing rights.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Investment Certificate&#148; means a certificate issued by the Company to any person in accordance with
the provisions of Article&nbsp;5.5, in respect of any capital contribution made by that person to the
Company.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Labour Union&#148; means the labour union of the Company established in accordance with the PRC Labour
Union Law, the EJV Law and other relevant Applicable Laws and regulations of the PRC.
</DIV>



<DIV align="left">
<DIV style="font-size: 3pt; margin-top: 16pt; width: 18%; border-top: 1px solid #000000">&nbsp;</DIV>
</DIV>

<P align="center" style="font-size: 10pt"><!-- Folio -->Schedule A-2<!-- /Folio -->

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">





<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Management Personnel&#148; means the Company&#146;s General Manager, Deputy General Manager, Chief Financial
Officer and other personnel designated as such by the Board.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Material Modification&#148; means a modification (whether by means of the imposition of additional
terms and conditions or otherwise) by the relevant government departments to, as the case may be,
this Contract, the Articles of Association or the intended business scope of the Company, the
Additional Permits or Tax Concessions as agreed or anticipated by the Parties, which in the opinion
of either Party, will have a material adverse effect on the ability of Parties to achieve through
the Company, their respective economic and operational objectives.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;MOFCOM&#148; means the Ministry of Commerce of China or any of its predecessors.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;MOF&#148; means the Ministry of Finance of China.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Permits&#148; means all Additional Permits, Pre-Establishment Permits, and a &#147;Permit&#148; means any of
them.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Renminbi&#148; or &#147;RMB&#148; means the lawful currency of China from time to time.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;SAFE&#148; means the State Administration of Foreign Exchange or its local branch.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;SAIC&#148; means the State Administration of Industry and Commerce of China or the relevant local
Administration for Industry and Commerce,
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Tax Concessions&#148; means any concessions or incentives with respect to Taxes granted to the Company
by the taxing bodies of the PRC.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Taxes&#148; means any and all applicable tax and taxes (including, but not limited to any value added
tax or sales tax, stamp or other duty, levy, impost, charge, fee, deduction, or withholding of any
nature and howsoever called or described) by whomsoever and wheresoever imposed, levied, collected
or assessed.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Trade Secrets&#148; means any technology, information or business operation information which is
unknown to the public, is capable of bringing about economic benefits to the rightful holder, has
practical utility and which is subject to measures in place and carried out in order to keep it
secret.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;United States Dollars&#148; or &#147;US$&#148; means the lawful currency of the United States of America.
</DIV>

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 6pt">&#147;Working Personnel&#148; means all employees and staff of the Company other than the Management
Personnel and the members of the Board.
</DIV>

<DIV style="font-family: 'Times New Roman',Times,serif">

<DIV align="left" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 12pt">Part B &#151; Interpretation
</DIV>


<DIV style="margin-top: 6pt">
<TABLE width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-size: 10pt">

<TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">1.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A reference to any Applicable Laws or to any legislation, or to any provision of Applicable
Laws or of any legislation includes a reference to such Applicable Laws or legislation as
amended or modified from time to time.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">2.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A reference to a &#147;person&#148; includes any individual or entity (including any company, business
or other enterprise or entity, joint venture, institution, state or government department), as
the context permits,</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">3.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>References in this Contract to contracts, agreements or other documents, shall mean the same
as amended from time to time.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">4.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>A reference to any PRC government authority, agency or department includes such authority or
department at State, provincial, municipal and other levels.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">5.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>References in this Contract to government ministries, bureau, departments, commissions,
agencies, etc. shall include all successor entities thereto.</TD>
</TR>

<TR>
    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>
</TR><TR valign="top" style="font-size: 10pt; color: #000000; background: transparent">
    <TD width="3%" nowrap align="left">6.</TD>
    <TD width="1%">&nbsp;</TD>
    <TD>Headings are for convenience of reference only and shall not affect the construction or
interpretation of this Contract.</TD>
</TR>

    <TD style="font-size: 6pt">&nbsp;</TD>

limitation&#148; respectively.</TD>
